meanings.sent1: She kept misaiming the dart and missing the target.
meanings.sent2: The archer was misaiming due to the strong wind blowing.
meanings.sent3: The robot misaiming its laser beam made for a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: Her misaiming of words in the speech caused confusion among the audience.
meanings.sent5: The misaiming of the telescope made the stars appear blurry and out of focus.

meanings.definition: The act of aiming incorrectly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: His constant misaiming led to many missed opportunities.
meanings.sent2: The misaiming of the cannon resulted in a failed attack.
meanings.sent3: The misaiming of the sprinkler made the garden look like a water park.
meanings.sent4: The misaiming of the compass left them lost in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The misaiming of the camera angle distorted the entire photograph.
